text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Iraqi press on Sunday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- President Saddam Hussein receives two Jordanian ministers and raises the oil grant to Jordan to reach $300 million for 1997.
- National Assembly urges world parliaments to end U.N. trade sanctions on Iraq.
- Nation-wide celebrations are held to mark the "science day" when Iraq launched missile strikes against Israel in 1991.
- Iraq and Jordan sign protocol of economic and oil cooperation.
- Protests in Paris and London condemning the U.S.-led aggression against Iraq in 1991.
(The above stories were also carried by QADISSIYA and JUMHOURIYA)
- Deputy prime minister Tareq Aziz meets in Amman with Jordanian premier.
